intro: Borya cataractae, commonly known as the cascade borage, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine pubescence, while its flowers bloom in clusters. Borya cataractae is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
